column1: ##### Open this document in Excel, version 5 or later.
##### To convert the semicolon-separated list to a normal Excel table, first click on the 'A' above to select the entire 'A' column.
##### Select column 'A' through 'K' (click + drag on letters above columns)
##### Right-click anywhere on the sheet (inside the selection) and select 'Column width' and set it so that only THREE columns are visible ('45' with 1024 x 768 screen resolution)
##### Right-click anywhere on the sheet again (still inside the selection) and select 'Format Cells' -> 'Alignment' -> check 'Wrap Text' + select 'Vertical: Top' -> 'OK'

##### Place the cursor in cell C1 and select 'Window' -> 'Freeze Panes' (allows you to scroll horizontally to see any language in the rightmost coulmn while still having the string names/comments and the english original text in the left and middle column
##### CAREFULLY read the instructions in cells B18 ? B36

column2: 1) '%s' is for indicating where another string is inserted, and MAY NEVER BE REMOVED! If there are more than one '%s' in a string, they may NOT CHANGE PLACES.

2) '%d' is for indicating where another integer value is inserted, and MAY NEVER BE REMOVED! If there are more than one '%d' in a string, they may not change places. ('%.1f' is used in exactly the same way but for non-integer values ?  '%c%d' is used for values that are displayed with a '+' or '-' sign in front, DO NOT CHANGE, ADD, OR REMOVE!)
3) '%t' is for indicating where the player's 'title' is inserted, however only in game message boxes.'

4) The characters '#' (hashmark), semicolon, '%' (percentage sign), '?' (paragraph sign), quotation marks and '\' (backslash) MAY NOT BE USED (except when used as control codes ? this will otherwise create serious problems!!! Quotation marks may not even be used in comments -- use a 'citation mark' (single) instead if necessary!)
5) A dollar sign, '$' will always automatically be replaced by the 'ducats' icon.
6) Any row with a '#' in the first column (column 'A') will be ignored. However, you cannot use any paragraph characters in these rows!!!
7) To insert a carriage return, insert a '\n' (backslash + n)
8) No formatting can be done in this file. To change the color of a text, insert the following codes in front of the word:

Note that the color change will be applied to all words after the code, until the end of the line that the word is printed on. If several words should have a color change, put the code in front of each of them to be on the safe side. If only one word should have a color change, make sure to reset the color after the word.

9) Unless otherwise specifically stated, length of words and texts does not really matter THAT much (message boxes, rollover help boxes and buttons WILL stretch to fit the text string) ? however you will notice once the translation is inserted that space IS limited in quite a few areas? so be brief, and try not to use words that are considerably longer than the english original.
10) ALL CELLS in column 'L' in this document MUST contain a character!
11) The LAST CELL in the 'A' column MUST contain the string '#EOF'
12) If you want to begin a string with a ' (citation mark), you will need to type it twice (Excel will read the first one as a commentary which is not not exported into the actual text database file)
WHEN DONE: save as 'Semicolon Separated (.csv)' format, and make sure the file is called 'Text.csv'.
NOTE: If Excel complains about an 'Error in formula' when the cell content begins with a '+' or '-' sign, type a ' (citation mark) in front of the plus or minus.

If controlled by other nation than owner the province will not generate any tax incomes and cannot build any troops. To assume control of a province move a military unit into it and defeat all enemy forces.
The owner gets all tax and production incomes from the province and can build troops fortresses and manufactories.
If your state religion and the province's religion are different, the revolt risk may increase. Click for details.

column1: #  COMBAT RESULTS ? describes combat status of armies and navies

column2: The higher the morale, the longer can your troops fight before breaking from a combat. Morale increases automatically whenever the unit is not in combat.
You cannot reorganize units that are moving, in combat or in different provinces

column1: #  These following pejorative adjectives are randomly inserted in some messages. The definite article ('the') can either be in the actual message or in this string ? the syntax in the english version is 'the %s [in %s have declared war on us]'.

column2: By pressing 'ctrl' and '+' or '-' simultaneously, you can change the time compression (game speed).
Pressing '+' or '-' works as a shortcut to changing the map zoom level.
Hitting the 'Pause/Break' button will pause or resume the game.
You can hold down the 'shift' key to add additional destinations to a unit's movement path.
If you hold the mouse still over a button number or symbol on the screen more detailed information will usually appear after 2 seconds.
If you click on the date uppermost centre the game will pause. Click again and it will continue.
To make your attributes (martial, diplomacy, intrigue, stewardship) effective you need to appoint advisors (marshal, chancellor, spymaster, steward) from your court.
Remember that if you change your laws your vassals will be mightily upset. At least a few of your vassals might make armed resistance against your break of tradition.
Don't forget to set your focus on developing advances. It does speed up the process of getting advances in areas of your interest.

Sea movement is simple just mark the unit(s) you want to move and right-click in the province you want to move to by sea and then make the confirmation in the action pop-up and it will move to its destination.
You portrait (uppermost right) takes you to your dynasty screen where you can see all persons related to you, and where you can check out your spouse, your children and your vassals.
Your shield (uppermost right) take you to all the realm screens where you can access the court, the treasury, actions etc.
Remember that to marry well you will need children and grandchildren to inherit from you. When your character dies you will most probably play one of your children.

Remember that a liege can arrange marriages for his vassals. If you are a vassal your liege can fix your marriage for you, and if you are a liege and have children that are rulers in independent realms then you cannot marry them.
Fertility follows the same patterns as the real world. Characters that are very young or old do not get children.
It is always better to have more men in your army than your enemy has. Also an enemy with a commander with much higher martial value than you will be a very tough nut to crack.

If you do not arrange marriages for your daughters you will slowly loose prestige over time. When you arrange such marriage you get prestige in proportion to the rank of your new son-in-law. Also if your new son-in-law is your vassal his loyalty will increase.
When appointing advisors remember that women cannot be appointed to Diocese Bishops or Marshals. However they can be appointed to Steward, Chancellor and Spy Master.

If the character portrait has a red square behind it and a royal crown then the character is a King. If it has a blue banner rolled around the portrait then the character is a Duke. If there are no attributes to the portrait then it is a Count.
You automatically get prestige over time for holding titles, the higher the title the higher prestige.

A big white banner with a red cross beneath your portrait and shield in the uppermost right means that the Pope has called for the crusade. The effects are that you get a piety penalty over time if you do not fight pagans and/or muslims, and a bonus if you do.
In the province window you see the buildings in your province and here you can upgrade them, but did you know that the landscape also show the terrain type in the province?
A big white cross near you character portrait means that the character is the controller of the Pope.
Beware of your character traits. Be careful when picking actions in the events as the traits you may get can trigger other events.

In the mid-13th century the Mongols will sweep into Europe from the East attacking on two fronts. One route will go from Bukhara over Bagdad and then towards Cairo and Constantinople, while the other will go through Russia towards Poland and Hungary. If Europe has warred too much you might have to stop them outside the gates of Paris...

In the mid-14th century the Black Death will arrive in Europe and start spreading. This will hurt the economy of most countries, but afterwards the economy will surge again. See to it that you have many successors as the grim reaper will take is toll.
Did you know that archers and horse archers are the only troops types that can hit in several combat phases?
Did you know that not only do Knights have the highest Shock value in combat, but also have the absolute highest morale value in the game.
Did you know that you loose prestige if you do not give titles to your sons?
Did you know that you will be able to choose educational path for your children when they are 5 years old?
Did you know that the quality of the education of your children will be decided when they are between 16 and 19?
Did you know that Pike Men have special bonuses against all forms of Cavalry?
Did you know that the attack and defence values of any unit are increased with different types of armour and weaponry advances being available?
Did you know that the controller of the Pope can excommunicate and revoke excommunication?
If you want to make one of your courtiers a duke then you first have to grant him a count title and then a duke title.
A duke can hold many counties making him a stronger vassal than a mere count.
Remember that sawmill decreases build time in your province. However you need a forestry first.
The Original Europa Univeralis was made by

This is the religion map mode where you can view the religion of the population of each province, and where Muslim is light green, Orthodox is brown, Pagan is grey, and Catholic is white.
Prestige is to be understood as your standing among you equals, in Glory, in Fame and in Power.
Piety is how well you incarnate the ideals of the perfected Christian ruler, in Justice, in Honesty, and in Meekness.
Gold is the amount of monetary resources you have. In other words, how rich you are.

A courtier is free to be assigned to any other service his ruler may deem fit.
A Marshal is helping his ruler with the task of running his lord's army. His martial attribute is added to the ruler's martial attribute.
A Steward is helping his ruler with the task of running his lord's treasury. His stewardship attribute is added to the ruler's stewardship attribute.
A Chancellor is helping his ruler with the task of coordinating his lord's negotiations with foreign courts. His diplomacy attribute is added to the ruler's diplomacy attribute.
A Spymaster is helping his ruler with the task of running his lord's personal affairs and supplying him with information. His intrigue attribute is added to the ruler's intrigue attribute.
A Diocese Bishop serves as the main clerical figure in the rulers own demesne. He may be elected to Papacy, and his piety influences the piety of the ruler.

They belonged to the highest societal stand and were often called 'Those who Fight'. They were Barons, Baronets and Household Knights upholding the law and defending the country. Defined by bloodline alone they held special status and rarely paid taxes.

They belonged to the next highest societal stand and were often called 'Those who Prayed'. The Men of God were the Shepherds of the Lamb who helped the lesser to serve God due their own abilities. The Clergy rarely paid taxes and were often the keystone in any serious administration.
They belonged to the next lowest societal stand and were often called 'Those who Worked'. They are free men and city-dwellers specialized in goods production and trade.
They belonged to the lowest societal stand and were often called 'Those who Worked'. They might be anything from free men to serfs, and worked the lands the dwelt on.

If you increase the power and loyalty of the Nobles you do it at the expense of the Peasants. Your regiment will hold more knights and heavy troops, you will get an instant prestige bonus, but you will get less tax income from the province.

If you increase the power and loyalty of the Clergy you do it at the expense of the Burghers. Your regiment will hold more light cavalry and heavy infantry, you will get an instant piety bonus, but you will get less tax income from the province.

If you increase the power and loyalty of the Burghers you do it at the expense of the Clergy. Your regiment will hold more archers and pike men, you will get an instant piety penalty, but you will get more tax income from the province.

If you increase the power and loyalty of the Peasant you do it at the expense of the Nobles. Your regiment will hold more militia and light troops, you will get an instant prestige penalty, but you will get more tax income from the province.
You currently gain %.1f percent of the income from your demesne. You currently have %d provinces in your demesne, and your ruler can only control %d directly.

An anonymous commander was often picked from the low titled nobility to fill the spot of regimental commander in times when all higher noblemen where occupied.
These are religious enemies and there is no need for any claims to start a war. When you sign peace the currently occupied provinces will be kept.

If you pledge allegiance to a ruler he will have to choose if to accept or not. If he accepts you will become his vassal and thus enjoy his protection, but will also be ruled by him.
If you offer vassalisation to a ruler he will have to choose if to accept or not. If he accepts he will become your vassal and thus enjoy your protection, but will also be ruled by you.
This action will mobilize all the regiments in the selected demesne.
There are no regiments possible to mobilize in this demesne.
This action allows you arrange a marriage between people in your own court.
This action allows you arrange a marriage between people from this court and your own court.

You can not declare war on this character. To be able to do that you need to fulfill one of the following conditions. A) A Claim on one of their titles, or B) They must be at war with one of your vassals, or C) They must be a religious enemy.
You have claims on this ruler, and may declare war upon him.
This ruler is at war with one of your vassals and you may declare war upon him.
This ruler is a religious enemy to us, and we may declare war at him at any time.
Revoking a title from one vassal gives the title back to you, unless your vassal wishes to contest that on the battlefield.
You do not have any titles which you can grant to anyone.
Click to grant any of your titles to a vassal, courtier or child of your selection.  This can be used to improve their loyalty, but may make them stronger.
By grabbing or stealing a title you use your prestige to manufacture a more or less legitimate claim on a title. This is something you can do when you have enough prestige and power to create a war.
There are no titles that this ruler holds that we can usurp.  We can only usurp when we hold at least half of the provinces in the natural area of the title.

This ruler has some titles that we can usurp. We can only usurp when we hold at least half of the provinces in the natural area of the title. A usurped title will give us a claim upon it, and we may use that claim to fight a war over it.
By creating a title we gain enormous prestige.  To create an historical and unclaimed title we must control at least half of the provinces in its area.
There are no titles which we can create at this point.  To create an historical and unclaimed title we must control at least half of the provinces in its area.

By suing for peace you are negotiating an end to hostilities. You may negotiate settlement of any claims between characters of the same faith, but between religious enemies only status quo peaces can be signed where currently occupied territory is retained. You can also pay or give tributes to sweeten any offer.

With this action you can attempt to assassinate another character. To succeed with this you will require a high rating in intrigue, and a good spymaster. Please note that assassinating anyone with titles is much harder than a regular courtier, or infertile wife.
Assassinating %s will cost %s. If we are discovered we will lose (%s).

The character's ability on the battlefield and his military administrative skill needed to lead and muster large forces.
The character's ability to make his gold increase by investments in profitable ventures and to avoid bad business.
The character's ability to get the most out of peace negotiations, and the ability to keep his vassals loyal, and the ability.
The character's ability to craft assassinations, the ability to defend against assassination plots. The ability to plot against neighbours and enemies (through Intrigue event series).
The current controller of the papacy is %s in %s
Without a proper set of fortifications in a province, it will quickly be seized by hostile forces.
Mountains have always been a formidable obstacle for armies on the move. They hamper movement and enable a prepared defender to hold off an attacker many times its size.
Hilly terrain is quite difficult to traverse for armies and slows them down. Defending forces can use Hills for their advantage.
Forests are large areas covered with trees which hamper army movement and limit visibility. They give advantages to any defender because they provide cover.
An open area filled with high grass which promotes movement and makes defence difficult as there is little cover in it.
An open, sandy area in which movement is not restricted in any way.
Marshes are very hard to traverse for armies. They slow movement down greatly, and give defenders a significant advantage.
This is the predominant culture in this province. There may be other cultures in the area, but this one is the most common and holds most of the power.
This is the creed which almost all who dwell here follow.
